indexing

Class BufferedBlockDictionaryReader

  • java.lang.Object
    • indexing.BufferedBlockDictionaryReader
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ITokenStream<PostingsListEntry>

    public class BufferedBlockDictionaryReader
extends java.lang.Object
implements ITokenStream<PostingsListEntry>
    Class to read arbitrarily sized BlockDictionaries one chunk of BUFFER_SIZE_IN_BYTES at a time. The implementation leans heavily on the implementation in ZipTokenStream, but there are some important changes: - This class reads only a single file (not a zip file with many entries) - Instead of Tokens, entries of type PostingsListEntry are generated. These are single Postings that store the associated term, docID and termFrequency. - The method #getCurrentTerm() returns the term of the next entry that can be retrieved by calling the next() method. This can be used by external classes to divide the stream of entries according to their terms, but this class does not do this implicitly.

      Returns whether there are additional entries to be retrieved via calling the next() method or not.
      PostingsListEntry next()
      Returns the next PostingsListEntry in the stream and sets the hasNext variable.
